result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenny M Day was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond to be applied. Balance to be paid within 60 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Kenny M Day in court with attorney Pamela L. Popken.  Defendant Kenny M Day in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Pamela Popken
Preliminary hearing on February 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   ***ALSO $750.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Kenny M Day in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Kenny M Day in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.   Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
